text:
3 pages of lunch specials...all under $8...that menu is available until 5p every day then again 9p on....clay pots etc....huge selection! Free hot tea and wonton soup comes with lunch specials...even available on Sat.  Late night way busier than any other time.
Went with the salt and pepper pork chops highly recommended, friend went with veggies and mushrooms in an oyster sauce and then the Sacha beef and vermicelli hot pot... Guess we were hungry . Salt and Pepper pork chops are perfect... With some flash fried garlic, green onion and jalape√±os...will have those again and again. Super friendly staff....
Friendly staff and good basic chinese food.  They have a big menu with a huge variety so be prepared to look at all their menus and specials.

I used to love this place. But they will never see me there ever again!  I made the mistake of paying first. Mind you I have done that many times before,  but this one night as tired and hungry as I was, the guy decided to take orders and fill them.  One after another after another and when I asked where my food was,  the guy who has ALWAYS got excellent tips from me, laughed at me.  I did notice one thing. Of all the patrons coming and going, I was the only non-Asian.  Racism? Maybe. I did see 3 mice in the bathroom as well

The service sucked! The waitress forgot our green tea and water. When the lady was getting our water,cups fell and she used the cups that fell for our water.  Felt ignored.  That's why I give this place 2 stars.  This is the second time we went to this restaurant same service.
Phenomenal! Hot & sour soup I dream of and honey shrimp beyond my best dreams!!!  My Chinese friend loves the BBQ pork fried rice, Mongolian beef and salt & pepper pork.

There are better Cantonese seafood restaurants in town. Sorry the food is mediocre. The staff not very attentive and the place is pretty filthy. If the dinning area is not very clean, can't imagine what the kitchen is like. Not a good place at all.

Place is pretty dirty and run down. Food is just okay. Went for dinner and order the usual, salt and pepper pork chop, beef chow fun, steam flounder, stir fried clam with basil. Probably just going to be a one time deal for us there's better place in town.

Favorite spot for Chinese food, especially late night when many restaurants are closed (after work for the graveyard workers). Waiter has been the same man for us each time. He's super nice, fast and efficient. They have lunch specials that are also honored after midnight.  Both dine in and take out has been great.

Our cab driver suggested this eatery as cheap and tasty and off the beaten (read: tourist) track. Wasn't disappointed. 
We had the orange beef and the kung pao chicken and couldn't finish the massive portions. They also afforded us a pot of complimentary green tea and a huge big bowl of pork and lotus flower root soup which was an unexpected pleasure!! And were nice enough to call us a cab when we were ready to leave.
Minus one star for having only one beer (heineken). Would liked to have supped on something a little more asian. Still, worth the visit... And cheap as chips!!

We wanted the steam fish shown in their menu but waiter says it's out of stock. We find that quite disappointing. The fish maw soup was ok. Squab was crispy and tasty. The pork belly dish was so so. Service is good. Prices were also more expensive compared to other local chinese restaurants.
Affordable and delicious meals! They are open 20hrs a day (they are closed for 4hrs accdg to the server). Good quality food. We'll def comeback for sure!

Came here with a party of 12 for grandma's 88th birthday celebration. We ordered 12 dishes (see picture ) and the bill was around $200. The food was okay. The service was immensely slow. At one point the buser came and grabbed four cups to refill with water, when he returned we asked who's was who's. He just shrugged his shoulders and walked away, a little strange lol

Ok.. Here I go..I want to like this place, so much that I tired it three times. Is so close to my house and open late that this would be the ideal place for me to get my  refills of my addiction of fried rice, they also have reverse happy hour and just in time for when I get off from work late at night. The service is good they're nice and attentive but I'm not here to eat the help, the problem is, that this fried rice does not satisfy my cravings, it needs something to give it more flavor every time I get home with my to go orders I have to add some Del Scorcho taco sauce, tapatio or whatever I find to give it more flavor but end up with Komex instead, the pan fried squid is too greasy and the tofu seafood soup too bland. Too bad that I have to leave China and head to the Sahara for good Chinese fried rice.
 I know I'll try again someday, is so closeTo my house, is hard to resist, hope next time they add some secret ingredient or some coke or something to the fried rice to make it memorable and make me come back, or at least add some MSG.

This is another place that offers late night discount menu in the Chinatown neighborhood in Vegas.   They were actually tucked away inside a shady looking strip mall nearby the main Chinatown mall.  The hours were almost 24/7 as they open quite late until 6am in the morning and opening at 11am again.

After a few visits from different trips, their flavors were always a little subpar their neighbors in the area. The cuisine was mainly Cantonese style.  Seafood seems fresh, but the seasoning was a bit off.  The nighttime discount menu items were about the same in prices compared to other restaurants in the area that does similar promotion.  Most of their dishes were on the bland side.  The benchmark dish, beef chow fun was on the oily side. 

HK Seafood Garden can be a good place to visit if your option late at night were limited.  The restaurant also caters to tour buses, which is a sign of mediocre.   If you are looking for good authentic Cantonese food, then you are pretty much out of luck here.
This place is off the hookgreat tasty chinese food 5 m Polynesian Samoan from The Bay Area! My Uso's in Vegas put me on 2 this spot & i aint never'd STOP esp aftr hours tow up! lol #UsoLove

This is my favorite place to eat chinese food in Vegas. The price of the food is very affordable. I love the salt and pepper tofu and the sizzling black pepper beef. I also like the honey walnut shrimp. I always want to go back here and enjoy good food.

Everything I have tried here I have loved!! Their hot and sour soup is the best in town, and their short ribs, chow fun, calamari, pan fried noodles, salt and pepper shrimp oh and yeah their reverse happy hour after 10pm! Great after a late night out!
Usually love this place until the last time we were there, all the fish were dead or dying in the fish tank display.....very turned off.

Not a bad place to celebrate your Chinese father's birthday. The food was tasty and fresh. The menu on the items were diverse. We even ordered ahead of time because of our large party of 12 and they accommodated. It's authentic and the portions are hefty. If you are in the area, you have to give it a try. But make sure you come early for lunch because it gets pretty busy. Everyone left satisfied and I got to take home the left overs to enjoy another day.

Hole in the wall type Chinese restaurant. Wide selection menu with authentic Chinese dishes and American favorites too.
Very casual atmosphere with no frills dining and basic service.  
Go for the beef noodles, we did and it was traditional and tasty. 
The salt and pepper chicken wings was freshly prepared with a large portion.  
The food delivered to the other tables also looked fresh with large portions. 
Restaurant was busy, it was a Saturday night.
Would definately return!

Def come during lunch and ask for the lunch menu. Dinner menu a little pricey. Salt and pepper pork chops were excellent. Beef stew curry tasted like beef stew... Not a huge fan of beef stew in the first place but tried the stew off someone's plate.

Looking for food before we head home to LA and at 12 midnight. Most restaurants off the strip are closed, but my brother looks on yelp and finds HK Seafood Garden. Looks like they are open til 6am and have midnight snack. They also serve the regular dinner menu. 

We arrive at the parking lot to see the darkened doors and are confused to if they are closed or opened. We then see a few patrons exit from the restaurant and there is "LIGHT"! So we exit our van and enter. We are sat down at a table and notice our surroundings. There is minimal Chinese decorations from a wide art painting and then some hanging decorations. We order 3 dishes to start; Dry Beef Chow Fun, Wonton Noodle Soup, and Clay Pot Rice with Chinese Sausages. The first two were good. The show case which was the Clay Pot Rice was the best. It's definitely hard to find clay pot rice at a Chinese restaurant, but when you do.. it's definitely worth it. It took 45 mins to cook and wow!! The flavours and texture is just beyond words. I recommend ordering the clay pot rice here. Towards the end of our meal, a small party walks in and orders some congee with oysters. My mom was interested and ordered the same congee. When it came to our table; we could smell the oysters and ginger from the congee. This will be great! And to our judgment; it was spectacular! We have finally found our new to-go Chinese Restaurant when we need some home cooked meal in LAS VEGAS!!! the city that never sleeps!

Really good place, friendly service, good Chinese food. I would recommend it to anyone who enjoys Chinese food. Their Thai tea is good as well, and I love the beef with Chinese broccoli. The place is pretty big, there's a lot of tourists who come here so it does get pretty packed sometimes. The manager is really polite and funny, the place is children friendly as well. Great food!!

I usually have a great experience at HK Seafood Garden.  I have taken many of my friends there at least five times and referred so many others there.

I met a friend for a business lunch there last week.  When I arrived at the restaurant, I was the second customer in the whole place.  My friend joined me about 15 minutes later.  We place our order and we waited forever for our food to arrive.  I asked the waiter several times about our order.  Many other customers came in, ordered, ate and left before we got our food.  

I had ordered Buddah's delight and asked them to just throw some shrimp in it for me so there would be no carbs.  My friend ordered Kung Pao Chicken.  What they brought me was some kind of seafood delight with noodles in it saturated in sauce.  I was trying to avoid the carbs.  It was good and I ate it anyway because there was no way we had time to send it back.

Every other time I have eaten here the food was amazing and the service was good also.  I will give this restaurant another try based on very good past experiences but it really is not worth me supporting this restaurant if we're going to be made to wait after everyone else in the restaurant is served before we are taken care of.

Well I came here with pretty low expectations since most Chinese places in LV was disappointing but everything I got here was just so good!  Its cheap and affordable, fast and service was on top of things.  We ordered an extra entree to go back to the hotel with.  Had the fish fillet with veggies, beef ho fun, crab and fish maw soup, and also the westlake minced beef soup.  They also offer complimentary dessert soup that was tasty.  I will happily go back the next time I am in town.

DO Not eat here if you value your health. 
13news just did a report on dirty diners..  This restaurant was in the list Health inspectors noted a trend of soiled debris build-up on shelving, pots and pans caked with dried flour and debris, and equipment streaked with grease. 

There were also dirty wares stored as clean including colanders, knives, bowls, and a raw fish scaler.

Inspectors noted repeat non-compliance with the rules.

Inspectors saw a food handler spread contamination by rinsing dirty hands over defrosting food in the prep sink. They were using plastic t-shirt bags, including one from Phantom Fireworks, for holding open meat.

And in this restaurant, frogs are food, but inspectors were concerned about live frogs being stored in a bag in the refrigerator. 

There was also food stored on the floor.

I would give this place a good 5 stars why? Because they are reliable they open til 6 am every single day so when I get off work I can just come straight here and eat really good authentic Chinese food *drools* I looooove their soups too it always comes in a good portion size and it's always hot. But yeah place is big and spacious, the atmosphere is always so chill and so relaxing. Place seems pretty clean and the workers are very nice and service is okay. Definitely coming back here at like 4 in the morning hahaha

Dim sum items were okay, nothing really stood out.  There was an ample amount of carts coming around and they were all nice and friendly.  We were a party of four and ate a number of plates and the total came to around $36 including tax. I think the dim sum at Ping Pong Pang is much better but slightly more expensive, but worth it.

I love coming to HK Seafood for tasty Asian food at a great price. Their lunch menu has dozens of noodle dishes, meat, and vegetable plates all under $8. 

I recommend the Chicken Crispy Noodle ($5) for anyone wanting to try something different from the average chowmein. The Salt & Pepper Pork Chops ($6) never fail to please either. 

Complimentary tea, lunch menu available at all hours, and free dessert late night make HK Seafood one of my go-to spots for Asian dining.

Food is good but the service sucks. They are not attentive. I asked for water and they gave me the pitcher but served everyone else around us. The pitcher didn't fill everyones glass. I literally  had to chase someone down for another pitcher of water.  They never checked up on us while eating.

The Chinese food here is fantastic.  At every chinese restaurant I go to, I always have to try the Kung Pao Chicken and Salt and Pepper Shrimp.  You know, those are the shrimp that are fried with their heads and tails on.  Both were fantastic - - great authentic flavor and a huge lunch portion.  The Shrimp and Kung Pao were only $7.50 each on the lunch menu - -  which is a great way to try the hundreds of things they offer on their huge menu.  Next time I'm dying to try their Ginger and Scallion Lobster.  The only warning I must give:  Be prepared to stay for a while!  They move slow, they cook slow, and they'll have you waiting a while to provide you with boxes and your check.  Just be prepared for that.  Otherwise, rock solid and excellent quality Chinese Seafood!  Well worth the wait.

Open late night is the only plus. Majority of the dishes are pretty pricey. We ordered the seafood combination and it was pretty bland. The Mongolian beef and sizzling chicken had good flavors, but it was on the saltier side. They don't have Sirracha, hot sauce, and soy sauce. We asked for hot sauce and got chillies in oil ( the same chillies that you would get at a dim sum place).
Great chef, great service! Beef and egg fried noodles, steamed clams are my favorites. Super tasty.

Where do you go when you are hung over from a night out in Vegas? You go to get food that reminds you of home. I remember my parents taking me to restaurants likes these in Chinatown LA, where they have alright service, dingy decor, and you always have to ask for water because they won't give it to you. But it is the food that remains most memorable as is the case here. I stumbled on to this place a couple of years ago and had a chance to go again twice recently. Now this is pretty much real Chinese cuisine and not Americanized . Go to Panda Express if you think that is Chinese food. Anyhow, got their clam in basil and salt n pepper shrimp with the shell on. Bomb is all I can say and the prices are more than reasonable considering the freshness of the food. Crab meat with moaw fish soup. Excellent with the red vinegar that they give you and some white pepper.I went back with my friend the next day but unfortunately my hunger was not as strong as the first day and the dishes we got we're not my usually. So stay with the basic if your taste bud is not too adventurous or go ethnic and get some curry dungeons crab which sounded killer too with some white rice.. go for the food!!' Not Trump.

the rumors are true, people.
they offer their lunch special menu during late night dining.
a reverse lunch special, if you will.

typical cantonese food is served here.
we had salt and pepper fish, house special chow mein, chicken wings and an eggplant and tofu hot pot.
everything was pretty standard.
the food and tea were both hot.
the breading on the fish was a little too thick.
the chow mein was nice a crispy around the edges.
the chicken wings were standard.
the eggplant and tofu hot pot was my favorite.

the service was quick and no frills.

for a cheap, late night meal, i'd definitely return.

I ordered one of their clay pot dishes and it was great! Service was good, it was quite busy because I went there during lunch time and I learned my lesson. Lol Overall the service and the food was good. I will be coming back for sure.

This is going to be my new late night spot! (and maybe lunch spot too!) After 10 PM you can order off the lunch specials menu, which means you can choose from 69 items priced between $5.50 and $7.50! Seriously, it's not a joke...I actually thought it was when Nelson Q first told me about it so I had to come check it out for myself.

We ordered a bunch of dishes for our table full of Yelpers, including: sweet and sour spareribs, chicken wings, sacha beef and vermicelli pot, XO spring beans, a couple of noodle dishes. All of our dishes were tasty and flavorful and I downed multiple bowls of rice along with them. The dishes are served in family style portions as you would expect with a standard Chinese restaurant, which means we had leftovers that we turned into a mix plate.

Service here was mediocre, but given that it's a traditional Chinese restaurant, you shouldn't come here expecting great service anyways. It was late when we arrived (around 11 PM) and it seemed like they were in a hurry to get us to order even though we were waiting for others to arrive. Wonder why that was because they're open super late as far as I know...Overall the food was great and we left extremely full and happy. I will definitely be back soon.

This place serves consistently delicious grub at the best price! They have this "lunch special" menu, obviously during lunch time and they've even given it to me when I've came in late at night. All the most yummy legit Chinese dishes you can imagine for the low! What's not to love?? The food is served family style and we usually order 1 dish per person to share amongst one another. This time around we ordered: beef crunchy noddle, yang chow fried rice, salt and pepper pork chop, eggplant and tofu in hot pot and Chinese broccoli in garlic. Like I said, everything... everytime... CONSISTENTLY delicious. The servers are nice and welcoming and when dining, complimentary hot tea and white rice always accompanies a meal. I've been here as late as 1am and I know they're open even later than that, just not sure on the exact time.
HK Star is way better than this! Fried pork was more like soggy pork!  Just look at the oily photo attached!

Love the food here!  Good and happy hour prices are great!  Service eh, but I'm at perfectly fine with taking it to go.  Love the salt and pepper pork chop, beef chow fun with gravy, and pork chop with mandarin sauce.  It's a great place to enjoy Chinese food without spending a fortune.

A friend told me to check out the Chinese restaurant in China Town.  You know, the one on Spring Mountain.  It's in that strip mall with the Vietnamese place--the one by the Asian Massage Parlor.   

The white folks I know seem to be pretty divided on whether it's a good thing or a bad thing when the vast majority of the patrons of a restaurant order food in a language other than English.  One camp argues that the food is more authentic in these establishments.  The other group is downright scared.  With that in mind, some of my friends would be terrified...but don't worry... HK Seafood Garden has a welcoming staff, they serve several American friendly dishes such as Sweet and Sour Chicken, and they'll even offer you a fork if you seem out of place.

I recently came in with a group that ordered entirely in Chinese....The best part was that one of individuals from our table took it upon themselves to walk back to the kitchen, check the cleanliness, and later returned after we ordered to let the chef know not to mess up our order.  

If you ask for it, they will bring out house soup for your table.  HK has one of the better versions of this soup that I've tried.

I've enjoyed most of what I've shared here a great deal.  Some of my favorites include:
Scallops with string beans in spicy xo sauce!
Ong Choy w/ Bean Curd
House Special Stir Fried Thick Noodle
ChaoZhou Shrimp
Whole Fried Fish
Dried Scallop & Mushroom w/ Snow Pea Leaf


The group agreed that this is one of the best places in Vegas for HK style Chinese food.

This place is the best to go to for good authentic Chinese food. Food is fast, fresh, and tastes good. The staff speak in fluent Cantonese, so everyone is accommodated for to get what they want. I recommend the beef chow fun, and the chicken chow mein.
This place has great service for a Chinese restaurant.  The portion was very good and so was the food. For the best value, go for the lunch or late night special.

I love this place the food is always hot and fresh randy our server is amazing he is the o my one that really speaks more English than all of them. He is not there on weekends but this place is amazing!!! Every time someone comes from Cali this is the place we come to and they all rave over the food!!!'got to try it.,

We went to the restaurant on Christmas Day for late lunch.  The place was full with no one waiting so we were able to get a table quickly.  However that was the only thing that occurred quickly when we were there.  They had two waitresses and a busboy working.  We grabbed the menus ourselves.  We also noticed other customers getting their menus, utensils, plates and tea because the waitresses were so busy.   It took us over 30 minutes to get our orders in and another 30 minutes to get our first dishes.  The dishes came intermittently and at the end we had to inquire about our three other dishes.   Apparently the chef (I think there was only one) forgot to cook them.  Fortunately we were not in any rush to go elsewhere that afternoon otherwise we would have been really late.   I believe we were there for over two and a half hours.  The food was good on par with the other Cantonese restaurants in the Spring Mountain Road area.  I probably will not return to the restaurant unless other restaurants in the area are closed due to their poor service.

Located next door to pho kinh do in the Arville Square shopping center. The value they give you here late at night is incredible. Being able to order from the lunch menu after 10 pm is a clear selling point for me. $7.50 or less for each dish, plus they give generous sharing sized portions is unheard of and an extreme bargain!

Ok, so maybe we ordered a little too much for the both of us. But, we honestly didn't expect the portions to be so generous! Next time, one item and possibly an appetizer or soup would be more than enough. 

Here's what we ordered:
General Chow's chicken $7.50 (flavor rating 4/5)
Hong Kong style crispy noodles $7.50 (flavor rating 3/5)
Eggplant with garlic sauce pot $7.50 (flavor rating 3/5)
Veggie egg rolls $5.50 (flavor rating 2/5)

Out of everything we ordered, the General Chow's chicken was the most flavorful. The rest of the dishes we're sort of lacking seasoning and flavor. They were not excellent and they were not disgusting, I would say they were average. The value and the amount of food they give you is the reason to keep coming back!

 Have I mentioned, I love this city?
I went there twice last year when I visited Vegas. I have to say it's the best Cantonese food ever! Good service!

This place was just horrible! Upon entering the "restaurant" , there was a tub full of garbage just sitting around in the middle of room, I don't like eating while there's a tub full of garbage gazing right at me.

To start off, we were only given one menu... with a party of 4. I know we're in an economic crisis right now, but really, one menu? Anyways, we proceeded to catch a waiter/waitress so we could order our dishes (waiters/waitresses were just wandering around the restaurant as if they were clueless), we ordered Half a chicken, Garlic Baby Bok Choy, Salt & Pepper Pork Chops, and a Tofu dish (We asked the server what kind of ingredients were in this tofu dish, and he stated "tofu", GEE thanks! I would've never guessed!) Once our order was taken, if your bill exceeds I think 40 dollars, you get a free side, obviously our bill exceeded 40 dollars, but nope, this stingy "restaurant" didn't even mention a free side, and we always got a free side every time we went.

When we got our Salt & Pepper Pork Chops, Half a chicken and Garlic Baby Bok Choy, we knew something was missing. They forgot the complementary soup! Every Asian Restaurant comes with a bowl of complementary soup! Every table got soup but us! (Note that this place wasn't even busy, service was just lazy).

Onto the dishes, the half chicken came first. It was very rough and chewy. The chicken had obviously been sitting around for a couple hours if not days.

Our next dish was the Garlic Baby Bok Choy. We've ordered this dish many times from various places, and it's a rather simple, yet satisfying vegetable dish. When the Bok Choy came... it was just horrific. As I was eating, one of my family members found bits and pieces of shrimp lurking within the center of the dish. If I remember correctly we ordered garlic baby bok choy, not bok choy with a special surprise in the center.

Moving on, our Salt & Pepper Pork Chops arrived. It was extremely greasy, very chewy, and some pieces were mostly just fried pieces of fat.

Now you're probably questioning why I didn't review the tofu dish, simply the fact is that we canceled that order as it came to us. My family and I are always up to try something different on a menu, but when we asked the waiter what ingredients are in this tofu dish and all he stated was "tofu", it's a bit shady. I'm actually glad we canceled the dish because when it came out, it was all soup and one or two colossal chunks of tofu drifting in the center.

To top it all off, I was excited to get my dessert! Oh wait, the waiters and waitresses forgot, just like how they forgot our free side and soup. 

My family and I have been to this restaurant numerous times, and we can understand the occasional accidents, we're only human. When stuff like this happens, it's sure to piss a family like us off, especially when we tip around 20%.

Obviously we won't be back.
Pretty good value for tasty food, but service was really poor. They forgot to give us napkins and gave us the wrong dish.

I waited the past 6 months for good Chinese food. Well worth the wait. I may not have Chinese food again  for another six months and I don't care, cause tonight, I've been completely sated. Vegas, you are nirvana. So they have slot machines here I hear.

This place is terrible! 

The prices for the lunch specials are about $7.50 instead of what the pictures show. I ordered the Beef in Oyster sauce and it not only took forever to come out but it was so salty it was almost inedible. If I hadn't gone all the way back to my hotel before eating I would have taken it back. The amount of food I got wasn't a good value at this price either, if I would have paid the $5.50 it would have been a little less mad. 

They also acted like they didn't want to take my cash since it was such a big hassle. For me to have to wait over 10 minutes for one dish when the restaurant wasn't even that packed is ridiculous. 

Fortunately there are a whole bunch of other restaurants around here because I will not be coming back!

Food is good, place is nice, cleanliness is good too. And service is excellent. Specially the Chinese  guy with the glasses he's very nice and welcoming he always asks if we need anything. He made an extra service, even if late and I know there tired already. Coming back and will recommend this restaurant.

Decided to come here little after midnight on Saturday morning, this place was busy with a big party with really only 1 man server, waiter, and a jack of all trades. When driving up, we thought maybe we should reconsider eating here given the time of the morning. I'm glad we didn't. Ordered the salt and pepper shrimp and it was fabulous! I've had the same dish in NY Noodletown, and Philly as well as Baltimore.  This is the best. The shell is perfectly prepared and is not a heavy coating and creates a perfectly salt baked shrimp!! Even the hubby who doesn't typically eat shrimp with the shell on and he liked it and had several shrimp. The other great thing is the dinner portion as in my picture was only $12.50? Unheard of for that much shrimp. 
He ordered his usual chicken chow fun. I would it rate second to NY Noodletown. 
I also ordered the Ong Choy but made the mistake of ordering it just saut√©ed with garlic rather than ordering it with bean curd or shrimp sauce as described on the menu. The server said they "both were exotic" and now in hindsight I would have chosen one, given how fantastic the shrimp was prepared.

DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME OR MONEY ON THIS PLACE! I have been coming here often with my boyfriend and every time that we dine in, the service is absolutely horrible. Not only did it take 15 minutes to just order drinks and our food, the two servers that were working were so damn rude. I will NEVER eat at this establishment again. The food is good and that is the only reason why we have tried to deal with the horrible service in the past. I should have left when I had to approach the server to take my order since she was ignoring our table. The WORST dining experience. Not even worth it.

The food is delicious!! Friendly staff, I typically come in after a late night/early morning of Vegas shennan's. Very clean, and again, bomb food. I'd choose this over Ph√µ Kim Long 100%. I spoke with a staff member about my awful experiences down the street and he shared how he takes pride in ensuring this place is clean and that the food is fresh. This is my go to!

This is my favorite Chinese restaurant in Vegas, at least so far. Open seriously late (6AM), with seriously good late night lunch specials, there's really no reason to go elsewhere. The prices are great, and the food has ALWAYS been high quality. 

Things my boyfriend and I have had, that I can think of off the top of my head, Minced Salty Fish and Tofu Hot Pot, Minced Salted Fish and Eggplant Hot Pot, Mongolian Beef, Orange Beef, and Wonton Soup. All very good, with the Wonton Soup being one of the best I've ever had anywhere.

Service is ok, but don't expect it to be fast here, at least not at night when there's only one waiter. They're always friendly. though.

this is our go-to chinese restaurant. my family have gone here numerous times, there were late nights, and early lunches, and no matter what time of the day. The service is great and fast and the food is really good. To me, it is authentic chinese food, not to mention a lot of chinese people eat here, meaning it's the real deal. The place is kind of run down, it's in the older side, and the parking lot is not a safe area and there are a lot of drunks, so be careful. I'd still return here and I wish they had dimsum too! Try their salt and pepper pork chops, fried tofu, yangchow fried rice, and egg drop soup! It's awesome!!! I even bring my out of town and out of the country guests here, and they all enjoy it.

Oh wow, this place is like my second home. I come here eveytime i ran out of options to eat, and also if i'm craving affordable chinese food. Staffs were a lil complicated to deal with but the food and the price is worth it.

Very solid Chinese restaurant.  The service was good and friendly.  The restaurant owner even took a picture for us.  They allowed us to bring in birthday cake that we were celebrating.  Good was good and pretty reasonably priced.  My mother in law's favorite Chinese  place in town because of the fish chow fun.  I'll be back when she wants to go!  Lol

The food is great and it came real quick. This place just have the same problems as other Chinese restaurants. Very bad customer service. You would try to ask the waiter for something and he would tell you to hold on until he's ready for you. We had five people with four lunch menus and one dinner menu.  When asked for another lunch menu he told us to wait for someone to be done with their lunch menu. Then he sounds irritated when we're not ready to order because the last person just got said lunch menu. They never really check up on you to see if the food is good or if you need anything. So half of our cups are empty.

Enjoyed the food both times Ive been here. They have a late night happy hour menu but they wont give it to you unless you ask. Make sure you do ask, as the prices are much cheaper and portions are the same. I hate when I go out and dont remember everything I ordered. The one thing I do remember is the egg rolls were eh. Wouldn't order those again. Oh, and I didn't care for the spare rib pot. Otherwise, of all the things I have tried, I enjoyed most.
Great Chinese restaurant. Best in Las Vegas!!!!!!!!!! Also have cheap lunch special and dinner special after 9pm 7 days a week.

Another place for cheap eats after 10pm..Reverse Happy Hour here means ask for the lunch menu and all the items listed are no higher than $7.50! It's also good to go with someone who can speak Chinese (Tony T.) You always get better service.

We started off with some Hot and Sour Soup and followed with Salt and Pepper Shrimp, Hong Kong Style Pan Fried Noodles, Beef Chow Fun, and Pork Spareribs.
Our party of five devoured everything in no time, thanks to the workout session at Shine Alternative fitness a few hours earlier. Each dish had its own distinct flavor and was very delicious!

 All the plates were empty, but all that was left on our lazy susan was a pot of about 750 to 1000 grains of rice which would be very shameful to waste, so we decided to order an Eggplant Hot Pot with salted fish which was also delicious, and we cleaned up leaving no survivors behind.

Total damage? $40.....a great choice for cheap late night eats, and if you're in Chinatown deciding where you wanna get your grub on....ALOHA!!!

YELP 365 CHALLENGE-(215/365) "Lunch Specials After 10pm"

Came by here for the second time late last nite after a night of a bit of First Friday Fremont Street hi-jinx with some of the co-workers and needed something to handle that buzz. Decor is on par with the typical Chinese restaurant standard with crustacean and fish tank on the right side -- to emphasize that it is in fact a Seafood Garden.

Jokes aside, I'd bypass the Pho Kim Long and head here for the cheap Chinese eats, with less grease than that other late night Chinese spot directly across the street whose name escapes me (below Ichiza). Me and my GF picked up 3 pretty decent vegetarian friendly dishes: fried rice, spicy eggplant tofu and vegetarian delight -- clocking in under $25. 

First time around as a pre-Las Vegetarian I recall ordering plenty of meat and seafood dishes with a few other heavy hitting Yelpers. This is where HK Seafood Garden shines. Its one of those places for you and a gang of folks to order some Chinese food favorites, chow down, share some laughs while recapping your night of debauchery and bounce. Throw in a "reverse happy hour" - which includes anything in their lunch menu and you have a great place to take care of your lil head change.
Dont even think of going to this place,customer service are way down to the level of the floor,horrible service.. they served each dish 5-10 Mins apart...

Super quick 24/7 Chinese food 
Super I mean like super oily Chinese food 
But cures that drunkness hahah 
Super cheap prices  
Your typical Chinese restaurant service' 
Chicken wings were super crispy and good 
Fried rice was good but oily Af 
The veggie was good but drenched in oil 
The crispy noodle was gross 

Not to far off the strip 
Good for late night Chinese drunk food haha
Excellent restaurant definitely need to try it out!! Dishes are incredibly delicious, big portions, and economical prices... Love this place!!

Live Coackroach on top of my plate of food, absolutely discussing.   When i told the waitress about it, she laughs and said she will bring another plate.   Service is terrible.  everything smells poor hygiene and sloppy.  Everything is sticky...menu, table, chair, dishes, soup spoon, etc.  The floor looks like it hasn't been mopped in years.

We have been here for years, but this time we went here , it wasn't very good.the service was ok. We wanted give 5 star for this place only the problem was we had waited long time anyway we will be back and see wether it will be same as before.

I came here between plays at the Vegas Fringe Festival.  At first I was seated at a table on one side of the restaurant but then one of the servers came and told me the table was too close to one of the large round tables and moved me to a similar table right next to another large round table that had a large number of people there.

It was after 6 PM but I was also given a lunch menu along with the regular menu.  They didn't have iced tea so I just asked for water.  After being moved, I was brought a pot of tea with my water and I ended up having two servers.  I ordered the scallops that were under the House Specialties section.  My server didn't understand what I wanted so I told her the number.  That didn't work either and she took the menu from me and started looking through the pages.  I gently got the menu back and showed her the correct item.  I also asked about a cup of soup but she indicated their soup was only large bowls.  I guess maybe if I had ordered a lunch special, I could have gotten a smaller portion.

A different server then took over and he spoke English.  He brought my dinner and asked if there was anything else I needed.  The scallops were on a bed of crispy seaweed that made a great counterpoint to the flavor of the soy based sauce in which the scallops were wok fried.  They bring you a large bowl of rice.  The menu showed a red pepper next to the dish indicating it was spicy.  It wasn't.  Maybe I got the non-Asian version because the server also brought me a fork before my dinner came.

I did like my dinner but if I come back here, I'll snag one of my Asian friends to order for me and make sure the dish is spicy.  This would be a four star if the ordering had been easier and if the dish was spicier than it was.

On a side note--this was a Saturday night and while I was there, a mini-bus pulled up and 5 of the large round tables were filled with tourists who are taken from the Strip to Chinatown for their dinners.  The place filled quickly and became quite noisy.

The menu is quite extensive and there are other dishes I'd like to try.  It'd be a great place to get a group together and share dishes.

I decided to hit this restaurant up after a late night/early morning visit to the gym. I read so many glowing reviews from other yelpers about their late night happy hours.

I ordered the wonton noodles and an order of chicken and salted fish fried rice. What can I say, the wonton noodles were extremely skimpy on the shrimp and the fried rice was extremely heavy on the oil. So I guess if you want inexpensive Cantonese cuisine at 4 am this is what you can expect. 

Why the 3 stars? The service was relatively excellent given the fact it was 4 in the morning and there was only one waiter for several tables. He was efficient and pleasant too...at 4 in the morning!

So although not the greatest Cantonese food, it is inexpensive, open incredibly late/early, and the service is pretty decent.

My friends and I came here around midnight after Life is Beautiful festival. So glad that they open until 6am because we were all craving Chinese food. We ordered many dishes including fried rice, chow fun, vegetables, soup, and more. Food came out super fast and the waiters were all very polite. Overall, a great place to eat at day or night.

I'm always in the lookout for the best bang for my buck. This place does not disappoint. First of all their food is delicious. They have a reverse lunch menu that starts at 8pm ( just ask) that has everything from crispy noodles to eggplant garlic hot pot. You really can't go wrong. I've tried everything. Favorites include: house crispy noodles w/ gravy, beef chow fun (very wok-y flavor), salt and pepper pork chops, fried flounder, home style black bean chicken, garlic shrimp, and general chow (yes it's chow on their menu) everything from 5.50 to 7.50. The service needs help but the food is fantastic.

Sometimes the best Chinese cuisine can be found in a humble restaurant.
  by donudare on 05/02/2014
Five stars for exceptional quality and freshness of the food they serve at an amazingly low price. Who would have thought that you can have an outstanding authentic Hong Kong cuisine good for two to three persons ranging only from $ 5.50 to 7.50 per order. No other restaurant serves this calibre of food at this price range. Not to mention the two friendly people who own this place working hard as servers, cashiers and managers all at the same time. No wonder they are able to manage, keep and maintain the prices of their top-notch food affordable. Instead of hiring and paying for servers, they do it by themselves with amazing efficiency. Lower cost of operation means lower food price. Make sure you go for their " Lunch Specials " which are priced amazingly affordable.Try eating at this place and you'll go home with a happy tummy and a smiling wallet! You cannot go wrong with HK Seafood Garden. If you haven 't tried this place out, you are missing out a lot! Hats off to the owners and Staff of this place for serving as top-notch HongKong cuisine at an incredibly affordable price. read less

My friends and I were hunting for late night food around Spring Mountain last night. The name HK Seafood Garden came to mind for some reason, so we gave it a try.

As we sat down, I started to recall that the name had come up as a decent choice for late night eats in particular. The presence of the "lunch special" menus on our plates jogged my memory - this was a place where you could get cheap eats even late at night.

After perusing the extensive lunch specials menu and failing to locate the one "premium" dish that I would have wanted, I settled on the cheap $5.50 beef chow fun, and I chose gravy vs. dry when asked. The dish looked promising, but the most impressive part ended up being the combination of the huge portion with the low price. Everything in it - beef, broad flat noodles, and bok choy - was massively underseasoned, as if it were pad see ew but without the flavor. Sure, you could add soy sauce, but it wasn't already present at the table, and I declined to ask because the lone server was stretched and because I was planning to take the bulk of it to-go.

Speaking of which, the service was understandably slow because the one guy (who can speak Vietnamese, which is a plus for this neighborhood) was working up to six tables when we were there. This may not be the late night restaurant of your dreams for that reason. However, if you have nowhere else to be, then it's not all that bad.

I did end up sprucing up my leftovers to an edible extent, but even though the portion was great, I won't be in a hurry to come back to HF Seafood Garden. The Vietnamese restaurant next door is way better, and I'm not usually around here late at night anyway.

This is our go-to Asian restaurant in Las Vegas.  I've been here many times, but only one dish really stands out to me: pepper and salt shrimp.  They do a really nice job getting a nice crispiness on the shrimp and flavor it well.  I could eat that stuff all day.

We went here for our engagement dinner with our family. It was BUSY for a Wednesday night and parking...well let's just say there isn't that many parking spaces available. For a party of 13, we were stuck in the corner closest to the door. Every time someone opened the door a gust of cold air would come in or the smell of cigarette smoke. YUCK! This was when it was raining for a couple days straight. Luckily, my brothers and sister are tiny, because putting them 4 in the chairs closest to the wall worked out. No average size adult would be able to fit....yes that is how crammed we were. 
In typical Chinese fashion, there was Lobster, Red Trout, Fried Flounder, Chicken, Beef and a lot of veggies. I felt that everything was just ok. Nothing too special and they had messed up one of the kids orders. I believe my Grandma liked it for the most part and that's all that mattered to me. Overall, I do prefer other places, but I won't be against coming back here again as long as I'm not sitting next to the door when its freezing outside.

I must say, this is one of the best Chinese restaurants that serve this style of food. They have some items that are Americanized, which is nice for those who like the crispy, sweet stuff. The happy hour and lunch prices are a definite deal. 

My highlight here that got me super hooked was the garlic eggplant in clay pot. I got so addicted to it, that I came back a few days later. And then, have been on a quest to replicate this item at home. I'm not sure if I've gotten it down yet. 

The veggies are good, and there was one more dish that blew my mind away. Check out my photos, and you'll see the comments on what it was. 
I'd come back here for sure if I'm craving a sit-down, better flavor version of Panda Express. Eh, maybe that's insulting to the business, but, you get my drift. 

Not the fanciest interior, but a great place for big groups. JUST DO THE GARLIC EGGPLANT in clay pot and you'll have no regrets.

The food was ok. Not the type of food that you would die to have again. The waiter couldn't describe any of the dishes which made it hard for us to order. We love trying new food places especially if the food is good. 

 Service is a big key for us. You can have outstanding food, but if your service sucks we're never coming back. Yup, the service sucked. We had to ask three different times for refills and when we asked for refills we received our response with an attitude. The waiter gave us our water by saying here and shoving it in our face, RUDE!!!!

I wouldn't suggest this place to any of my friends. First impressions everything to us. 
This is just my experience, my opinion and how I felt. 

Aloha & hopefully others will have a better experience.
The razor clams in Chinese style sauce is one of the items I enjoyed most. No complaints with the service.
so far this place is really good...better than most chinese restaurants we go too...the service needs more work but I LOVE their salt & pepper shrimp...so crunchy and YUMMY!!!

Very good authentic Chinese food at very reasonable price especially during lunch time or secret reverse happy hour after 8 pm you can order from lunch menu again just ask them. I love the yang chow fried rice for $5.95 , crispy noodle with  chicken $5.95 , salt and pepper pork chop $5.95 as well. For $20 cab feed a family of 4 easily
Waited an hour to get some rice and one dish. We ordered total 8 dishes and it took them forever to cook. Waitress were not helpful too. Giving attitude. Won't be back again. Such a waste of time.

This should be 3 1/2 stars.....i found it not good enough for 4 according to my standards. The place is nice the food was pretty descent, not great. The server couldnt describe any of the sauces which made it difficult to decide what to order...they have a massive menu. Im not critiquing there service in any way....but solely on their food. We ordered the scallops in sechuan sauce and creamy shrimp with walnuts. First the scallop dish...i thought the flavors were ok. The dish was really spicy which i like...i wish it was seasoned a little better because i found it a little bland. But thats just my preference. The big negative about this dish were the scallops themselves. They were really rubbery and overcooked. Next were the creamy shrimp with walnuts...im still not sure what i think about this dish. Nice size rockshrimp battered and fried with a mayonnaise based sauce and slighly candied walnuts on a bed of shredded ice burg lettuce. the sauce is confusing to me. The flavors were ok except that i kept tasting mayo...im not saying it was bad but it was a weird combination of mayo shrimp and white rice. All in all i would go back to try some other dishes. because there was so much on the menu i was overwhelmed...btw service was good.

Not bad, Not bad at all. 

Late night Special Review: 
For you late night diners like me, you appreciate places that open late. Here's a tip, After 10pm ask for the Lunch Menu. Its a special they have after 10pm you can order anything off the lunch menu, which is exactly like the dinner menu except for half the price. Dinner entree's range from $12-15 but off the lunch menu after 10pm everything's about $7.50.

Food:
So if your eating Chinese its always accustom to share, My friend Yuhi & I after an intense work out decided to ruin it by eating greasy Chinese food (Why not LOL). 

Egg Plant and Tofu: 
Super hearty, the fried tofu was crispy on the outside and fluffy in the inside. The eqq plant was juicy and soft. Glad the skin of the eqq plant didn't feel like plastic. It practically melted in your mouth.

Sweet and Sour Pork Ribs:
I'm a die heart fan of Chinese pork ribs, not just any old sweet and sour pork. I special ordered it as pork ribs. The cooked pork with the in bone ribs adds a smokey flavor the the sweet and sour and just brings the flavors together in a sticky sweet and sour sauce. They garnish the place with big chunks of green pepper. onions and with a twist pineapples. 

Good Food for a Good Price :) I'll be back.

At this place right now..came in at 11pm..food not out til midnight..ppl that came after us had their food way before us..when food came out everything was cold..manager was ignorant, didn't want to listen..they took the food off the plate and refried it and put it on the same plate ..health code violations..with the same cold ass rice...manager still charges me for the food..chilli oil and soy sauce on some tables going rancid...like our table

Ladies bathroom disgusting. Utensils and dishes given to us were pulled out from the dishwasher in midwash still covered in a film of oil and some food particles.  Asked the server to exchange them and came back with "new" utensils that were in the same condition.  Found a hair in my food.  Ok I'm Chinese and I know all the really good Chinese food places are not always the best in sanitation.  At least keep your damn dishes clean!  Customers notice this stuff and they'll start looking for more flaws.  So gross.  Never coming back.

I love having lunch at 10pm. Who doesn't?

Tony T let us in on a little secret. They have a reverse happy hour, which basically means you can order off the lunch menu at night. I think it's 10pm until close. Apparently, a few places in the area do that. But this is the first I've heard of such madness.

The food was all good. Or maybe we were all just uber hungry from our four-hour alternative fitness session.

Hong Kong style pan-fried noodle. Pork spare ribs. Salty fish hot pot. Salt and pepper fried shrimp. Hot and sour soup. Beef chow fun. All that fed the five of us for a measly $40 with tax.

I now know where to go for late night cheap eats. Even if my Chinese is a little rusty. And by rusty, I mean non-existent.

A lot of people might say this place is not worth 5 Stars, but I disagree, here's why: It is open until 6 AM, I get off work at 4 AM from my job on the strip & it is very close to the strip. Their late night menu is the same as their low priced Lunch menu: $5.50 to $7.50 for the most part. I LOVE EVERYTHING I HAVE TRIED HERE! Seriously this is my new go to Chinese Restaurant, anytime! My favorites are: Salt & Pepper Pork Chops, Beef Chow Fun & Beef & Bitter Melon. Other people have said that they have had bad service here, but at 4:30 in the morning, I have nothing but great & fast service. I will say this, if you are looking for a nice date, kind of restaurant, this isn't it........ but if you are looking for a hidden gem, more local's kind of place with great food & low prices, this place will be hard to beat!

A place with a really similar menu to the venerable HK Star. They fail to execute the dishes as eloquently and inexpensively as HK Star. Located across the street from Ichiza and right next to (Pho) Kinh Do! 

I came here with a tougher critic than me believe it or not, my Mom on a Sunday evening. No one else was in here, not a good sign.

@ Soup - Included in the meal. Was good, on par with the stuff at HK Star.

@ Shrimp Tofu - The tofu was good. I saw the shrimp, but couldn't really taste the shrimp at all since it was overpowered by the tofu. Just get the regular tofu next time.

@ Sizzling Beef - This came out sizzling on a plate. While this was a good item, it was sauced fairly heavy and a little more on the salty side. Food Express got this dish right.

@ Bi Fung Tong Seabass - My favorite dish at HK Star. Even though HK Star uses frozen seabass in their dish, this place doesn't taste as fresh as them. It just lacks the spicy kick that HK Star offers. Not a bad dish overall, but could be a lot better.

@ Roast Duck - This duck was so bad, I recommend going to Sam Woo to get your ducks, and I recommend against going to Sam Woo entirely in the past! In all fairness, HK Star has fairly bad reviews on their duck as well. It lacked the nice crispy skin and firm meat that makes duck so unhealthy to eat, but oh so good.

@ Thai Ice Tea - It was whatever. I've tasted much better stuff before. 

@ Carrot Desert - It was a carrot dessert soup. I was full, so I opted out of it. It is included in the meal. 

Lobster is $10 a pound, $1.12 more than HK Star. Across the board, everything is about the same or a couple of bucks more than HK Star, but nothing too terribly expensive. They also have a $5 and $6 lunch special menu like HK Star. 

This place seems to have a wide selection of ChaoZhou dishes. Upon further research, this type of cuisine tends to have healthier seafood and veggie dishes than other Chinese cuisine. They tend to go less on flavoring, letting the ingredients speak for themselves. A similar philosophy to Japanese food. Whether this place actually follows this philosophy, I can't confirm.

This place is fairly new, having been here for 5 months. This place is NOT related to HK Star in anyway, despite the similar menu and name. The inside feels cheap with all the fans in there. But the best chinese restaurants are notorious for not looking nice inside!

Service is really iffy. In terms of getting food out, they're not as fast as HK Star. Since its only a couple of mintues slower, its still reasonable for the dishes. The waitress there speaks mainly Chinese and very little English, so there may be language barriers to those who only speak English. 

They have 2 promotions where  if you spend $38+ you get a free vermicilli dish and if you spend $55+ you get a free ~1.5lb crab. This was cool and all, but the waitress could have just answered my question of how much I needed to spend to get to $38. She was asking me if I wanted soda or thai ice tea, implying it was free. I got charged for it. When I asked her about, she says oh, its to get you to $38 to get a free item. Just tell me that I need like $3 more to get there and I'll pick my own item. Uncool to do it in a sneaky way like that. I was able to get a duck instead of the vermicilli dish with a little social engineering.  

I only came here because I'm a food whore and I like to check out my other options, despite HK Star being very good to me. I guess I'll be put my head in shame as I walk back into HK Star to ask forgiveness.

You would only come here if you factor out HK Star or wanted ChaoZhou dishes. HK Star is better than this place in every way, price, taste, and service. The only thing this has over HK Star is its more tourist/ East-side friendly since its closer to the strip and open till 3am for our late night eaters. 

Not Chinese Mom approved.

One of the best place to have lunch. A lot of good items for $5.50 - $7.50 each. Good portion as well. Makes me wonder why I still spend my lunch money somewhere else. And, thanks for Yelp, now I know that they also have a late night special.

I notice that everyone who have a one star was very pleased and loved the food till that one bad experience they had. Why complain about that one bad experience I get it if u had a horrible experiences every time but you didn't. Anywho this place is actually pretty darn good and they close at 6am. I got the beef chow fun and the pork blood with leek. It was yummy!!!! I'd come here again and the fact that they close late I give them a thumbs up!!!!! Haters gonna hate and people will always complain. Who cares!!!!

Past 10pm?  Looking for some cheap food that isn't fast?  From 10pm - closing, you can order off of their lunch menu, where the most expensive item was only $7.50.  When we were initially seated, we were given the regular dinner menus and had to ask for the lunch menu, so be sure to do the same.

Our group of five ordered six dishes, totaling $52, and we had left overs!  Salt and pepper shrimp, ribs, chicken wings, hot and sour soup, an eggplant tofu dish, and a noodle dish.  All were delicious and came in generous portions.  Be sure to have friends with you if you're ordering more than one dish!  For any late night dining needs, this is truly one of the better deals I've come across.

http://www.ktnv.com/news/dirty-dining/dirty-dining-hk-seafood-garden-and-six-more

Need I say more? This is disgusting.
Really good traditional Chinese food! A lot of varieties and I highly recommend brining your family here for a gathering for special events

Finally, I found a Chinese restaurant that I love! 

It was 7:30ish at night, I was tired from work and did not want to cook. I figured I wanted to eat rice, so I opted for Chinese food. This restaurant was referred by my Chinese patient (it had to be good, right?). I ordered yang zhou fried rice and salt and pepper pork chops. I did not even mind the service because I was here for their food. My order came quick. I ate about half of my rice, it was that good and I was that hungry! I also enjoyed the flavors of my salt and pepper pork chops, although I think that the breading was an overkill. 

I am looking forward to trying out more items in their menu!!!
Get the bitter melon with beef, and the eggplant with tofu for the lunch special of $7.50...can't beat that!

Tried this place for the first time today and I thought it was ok. I usually give good reviews for good food but in this case it was the service that brought it down. Overall the food was pretty good. We had Shrimp with Lobster Sauce and Chicken Chow Mein. In regards to the service, once we were seated it took at least 10 min for someone to take our order. Halfway through waiting I even looked around to find someone but none of the staff was around as if everyone had went home! Pretty ridiculous. The food came out in decent time but after waiting for service I was pretty much done. At least the food was good so I may be back but there are much better places to go to with good food AND good service so we'll see.

Definitely 3 stars for this place because everything seems just average and no disappointment or great impression whatsoever.  Foods are alright; nothing spectacular.  Service is just A-OK as in the typical Chinatown style from which one should not expect too much.  Decors? hmmm....very minimal.  What I have enjoyed a lot is the appetizer platter; the Teochow appetizers including the slow cooked pork intestine, tofu, peanuts, etc. are made authentic and soooooo yummy! Their special marinate (soy sauce) is so tasty!

Service in this place is a hit or miss, sometimes they'll be really accommodating and other times, like when the restaurant is really busy, they'll come take your order,bring the food out, and you won't see them again till you ask for your check lol now if you can get past that, the food is actually good. My family and I love having lunch or dinner here since its so cheap and always good. We usually get the fried flounder, the crispy house noodles, and the chicken and dried fish fried rice. I think those are all a must try in there! I've tried other places and sometimes it tastes too much like msg, here it doesn't and the food isn't greasy. I'm not quite sure what time, I think around 10pm, the price goes back to being the lunch price so it's a great cheap spot late night as well.

I shall preface this by saying I'm a vegetarian, which is the reason for such a poor star rating. If you're a meat eater, disregard my review. You might think I'm a jerk for giving a bad review of a place with the word "seafood" in the name, because of their lack of veggie options. But I have my reasons.

We hit up this spot in desperation as we were looking for early morning Chinese. Props for being open 24 hours a day. Your tea was fine and your rice was well cooked, but that's all the positivity I can force out for this business.

The majority of Chinese restaurants I've gone to all over this country have been able to competently accommodate vegetarians. Not only were options limited, but the waiter genuinely seemed to not want to offer alternatives.

You don't have veggie egg rolls? You can't make veggie egg rolls?

You can't conjure some fried wonton shells?

You don't offer fried rice without egg?

We asked if there were a number of simple accommodations that could be made and the waiter replied "no no" before we'd even finished asking the questions. He just seemed to be pretty anti-vegetarian.

On the flip side, my friends really enjoyed their beef dish and spicy chicken rice. But I sure as hell won't be back.

This is the spot for lunch specials and late night specials. I didn't catch until when is the lunch special offered, but at night they let you order the lunch specials after 10pm. The menu is quite large and all under $7.50. 

I've never been as it doesnt really stand out outside and is in a shopping center that's easy to drive by and not know what was in there. I came with a group of friends who have been here for late night eats after going to 2nd Chance Prom. 

We ordered family style - 

Crispy noodles with seafood - the noodles and veggies were good, but I found the calamari a bit fishy. 
Eggplant and tofu with garlic sauce hot pot - this had great flavor and liked how the tofu surface soaked up the sauce quite a bit
General Chicken - this was actually really tasty. It was prepared in a way that reminds me more of sweet and pungent than most places Tso's and has a nice light crisp to it. 
Salt and Pepper Shrimp - these were cooked to a crisp to where you can eat the shell and all. I can eat a lot of these. 
Greens steamed with garlic - simple but good. Gotta have some veggies. 

It fed 5 people well for under $50 - not bad! I did appreciate that items weren't as greasy as some other Chinese spots open late. 

It's no frills, quick and cheap food that's pretty decent. If you're looking for a cheap lunch or late night meal then try out this spot. I will be back!

We have been coming here since i can remember & writing this review is reminding me of how unhealthy chinese food is but man when i want crispy noodles this is my go to place. Served with big pieces of chicken breast and chinese brocoli & deep fried noodles smothered in a gravy like sauce . Yes please ! Everything here is decent but some of my favs are ....

String Beans with Xo Sauce - Wok fried green beans stir fried with pieces of ginger and jalepeno in xo sauce whatever that is its bomb as f*ck ! Menu says its spicy but not IMO.

Salt & pepper fish fliet - Fish tempura battered and fried garnished with crispy garlic and jalepeno . So yummy !
 
Sweet & Sour Pork RIbs - Smothered in a thick not runny sweet n sour sauce wok fried with pineapple , green pepper & onion . 

Mongolian Beef - probably my favorite mongolian beef it has almost a citrus flavor like t has lemon in the sauce 

Ive tried many other things but these are my favorites . Call me basic but im not ;)

Since January I've been here at least 4 times because one dish is perfect for my diet.

5-Stars for:
- The cheap and huge selection from their Lunch Specials menu is also served late at night (I eat there around 1 am).  They're open 11 am - 6 am so perfect for a nocturnal schedule.
- I always get the Lunch Special #68 (it's a hot claypot tofu seafood + pork combo) for $7.50.  It comes with white rice which I decline because I'm on the Paleo diet.
- The meal also comes with free (Chinese pot of) hot tea, which I forego and instead get/drink just ice water.
- With tax it comes out to $8.11 + tip so I'm paying total $10 for a tasty, hot claypot of pork and shrimp/fish/tofu/mushrooms/squid (or octopus).  I like tofu and they make theirs really well.

Not that I hit the nightlife much nowadays, but if my partying cuts short before 3AM (when they close) then I'm for sure making my way to HK Seafood Garden!

Nelson & Sylvia Q. tipped us in on the secret reverse happy hour. You won't see it advertised and they sure as heck won't tell you about it. But after 10pm, you can order off the lunch menu. When our group of 5 was seated, they handed us the dinner menus. After inquiring about the lunch menus, I discovered the lunch menu is the dinner menu at lunch prices. Specifically, cheap lunch prices. Dinner entrees wavered around $12-15 and nothing on the lunch menu was over $7.50. Step aside Pho Kim Long, HK Seafood is officially my new spot for post-drink eats.

My Chinese of preference is Yunnan / Sichuan style but HK Seafood makes some of the Hong-Kong style classics amazingly. The salt & pepper shrimp, ribs, and chicken wings are awesome. The shrimp are pretty large and fried head-on. We also ordered a hot & sour soup, eggplant w/ tofu pot (my favorite!), and HK-style seafood chow mein. *yum*

Service is alright, but the quality and taste of food is pretty dam good for a hole in the wall!!! Definitely recommend this place for authentic Chinese cuisine. Prices are reasonable and seafood is fresh and cooked to perfection. Portions are big and they give out free soup and dessert as well!!!


Definitely get the razor clams!!!!! 

Will definitely be back and hope to be a regular!

The food is good but the service is soooooo horrible. We're seated at 1:45pm and our first order wasn't serve till 3:05pm. Was never asked what to drink and had to asked for utensils twice to eat with after the food was being served. Will never come back.

Just like everyone else is saying, this is a great place to eat late!

You get to order off the lunch menu after 10pm!  You HAVE to ask for the "late night specials" though, and they will hand you a lunch menu instead.  Most of the prices are under $7.50 for great food and portions :)

First up, the Salt and Pepper Shrimp ($7.50 HH). Great S&P Shrimp! Maybe a tiny bit overcooked, since the shells were a little difficult, but very tasty and good portion for the price.  Hit the spot :P

Also tried the Shredded Pork with Garlic Sauce ($7.50 HH). Great garlic flavor with tender pieces of lean pork! I meant to save half of this to take home, but I seriously couldn't stop eating it!! It's been a while since I couldn't hold back lol

Great food, great portions, and great prices.  Easy 4 star review!  I am sure I will be back, and if anything blows my mind, I might just bump up the review!

Pics :

Very nice find in Vegas Chinatown!  The prices are very reasonable.  Then you see the large portions you receive and it feels like a bargain.  Everything was prepared with traditional Chinese tastes, which means very good and authentic tastes.  I am Chinese, born overseas, so I have a reasonable perspective for this.  You even get the complimentary starter soup, big pot of rice and dessert at the end of the meal.  Feels like the good old Chinese restaurants of NYC.  

If you are looking for true Chinese food, come here and enjoy!  Service can be a bit chaotic because they can be super busy during dinner times.

This has got to be the worst service I have ever experienced at a restaurant. Me and my family came here after we saw a show because it was one of the few restaurants open late. Our server messed up one of our orders and it took them over 15 minutes to bring out the correct dish although we were one of the three tables there. When we tried to get his attention and ask for some rice, he shouted "what?!" at us in a rude manner. After, our waiter ignored us the whole night and was more focused on his friends at the other table and was drinking beer with them. It felt as if we weren't worth his time. It was like we were waiting for him rather than him waiting on us. He kept walking in and out of the kitchen passing us but never making eye contact or checking up on us. We finally got anther waiter to give us our check. The whole time me and my sister would speak English to him, he scoffed at us in a manner as if we were dumb for not speaking Chinese. The food was good, however, it was not good enough to make me want to go back.

I definitely will not recommend this place to friends, family, or others. Never going back.

One of the better Chinese restaurant on the spring mountain road.  Quality food and good portion.  Very attentative friendly staff which is definitely unusual for a Chinese restaurant so I really appreciate that.
Lobster Cantonese fabulous. Great service and friendly atmosphere loved every minute!!!!!!!!!

My favorite Chinese restaurant, EVER! Authentic cooking for such a great price. Staff is ok. You just ask for water or they don't provide. I guess it's like that at most Chinese restaurants. 

They have daily lunch specials that range from $5.50-$7.50. I believe it's from 11am-3pm. Yay!

Everything is cooked to order and well seasoned. The restaurant itself is not fancy, but if I can get good food, I'm there. Parking can be a nightmare during peak hours. 

They have a large menu for you to chose from. This is definitely a spot you can dine in from lunch to midnight hours!

Food here is really delicious and it's not too over priced. 

Definitely get the seafood pan fried noodles. So good!

What else can I say but the food here is DAMN GOOD. Super authentic and great tasting. We had the Sweet Sour Pork, Salt & Pepper Chicken, Chow Fun, and Cake Noodle. Each dish as they came out were immediately attacked! Lastly, I'm not sure what it is about Chinese Tea (from a Chinese restaurant)

The good: lunch specials after 10pm and the food tasted ok.  Nothing that knocked my socks off, but also no major flavor problems.

The bad: for those of you who play Cards Against Humanity it's time to play the fiery poops card.  Seriously, bad stuff and I'll leave it at that.  But, if the stomach discomfort wasn't bad enough the ladies bathroom is 1) disgusting with a barely functional toilet and 2) like something out of a horror flick with burned out light bulbs and inadequate light to see without using my cell phone flash light.  

Since their public customer areas are not kept in good condition, I'm certain their kitchen is probably maintained about the same.  In retrospect, it is no surprise we were treated to a double dose of germs and contaminants.

This is my hands down #1 go-to spot for authentic Hong Kong style cooking in Vegas, Just try these dishes and change your life! 
1. Hot & Sour soup
2. Whole roasted/crispy chicken
3. Dry scallop fried rice
4. Garlic Choy Sum
5. Salt and Pepper shrimp/crab
6. Deep fried flounder fish
7. Crispy noodles with vegetables 
8. Hong Kong style clams
You're welcome

I picked up some lunch specials to go...you can't really go too wrong with $5.50-7.50 dishes.  I got the beef crispy chow mein, beef chow fun, and Mongolian beef.  The taste was pretty decent and the portion size was good for the chow mein/chow fun.  However, the Mongolian beef was a big disappointment.  I think there was max of 6 pieces of tiny beef mixed with tons of onions and peppers.  I would have rather paid full price for the dish for more beef.  I would probably still go back and order noodles or fried rice dishes since the price is right and the flavors are pretty good.
Terrible customer service. The lady on a ponytail dont have manners. They don't refill your drinks.

Great services and great fresh seafood! The owner were super nice and friendly to all the patrons, which i don't see often at other Chinese restaurants. The food was really good and fresh, i loaded tons of pics, you can sure tell, highly recommended!
Will be back to this Local Cantonese Traditional Fav. Opens 11pm to 6am. Great Foods. And Tons Great Special Low Price items. We will be back for Big Dinner.
Good food and great prices. More importantly they have a letter A from the health district
The food was good but service was absolutely terrible! For someone eating for the first time at this place they should treat customers better and not ignore them!

Hong Kong style authentic Chinese food not for the PF Chang crowd.  Seafood dishes are the best.  Try the scallop-fried rice.  The mushroom/filet dish and hot pots are gr8.  Lobster could be cracked out of shell b4 being served.  Hard to eat w/chopsticks.  Service is quick and attentive.  One of the best Chinese restaurants in town.

I love this restaurant because it has insane hours.  I can now go eat at a great Chinese restaurant with fantastically reasonable prices until 6am!  What a gem!!!  I highly recommend this restaurant who wants some authentic good Chinese food like I'm used to having in Hong Kong and New York.  It will not disappoint.

We always come here for special occasion. The waiter is great and they are very approachable; they will honor custom requests as well! This the only Chinese restaurant that we come for Salt and Pepper Squid dish. It takes the trophy!

The salt and pepper shrimp were delicious.  The shrimp were about the most tender I've ever had in that dish.  The egg rolls were OK, but nothing special.  The hot and sour soup was OK, but would have benefited from more "sour". The vinegar had been largely cooked out.  Service was fine.  I'd eat there again.

Wow....T.T. is good.  I love the review.  I've only been at HK Star once and I did enjoy their food but tonight was about HK Seafood Garden.

I rated this place higher because of the friendly waitress and staff and also their good food.  I was with great company so...that helped them get the four stars also.  :op

This month's special was the fried flounder.  It was very crispy and moist in the inside.  That baby was gone right away.  It was delicious.

The place was clean.  There were ample people in the restaurant when we got there and slowly people started coming in.  

Overall the service was great, the place was clean and the food was tasteful.  I recommend.

Went for lunch on recent trip. Was told that the dim sum was great. Was seated, not too long of a wait. Ordered hot tea and didn't come for about 15mins. No food either. Waiters and waitresses very rude. When we finally got some dim sum, everything was way too salty, greasy, and cold. Believe me, this is no where near the best dim sum as other people have yelped. One and done. Will not come here again.

The lobster with ginger and green onions was the best I'd ever had!!! I love how it is already diced. The cook brought the lobster out to make sure it was the one we wanted and 10 minutes later we were eating it and had no conversation because we were too busy eating!
